metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36427 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
GNOME gThumb before 3.10.1 allows an application crash via a malformed JPEG image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gthumb - 3.12.2-1
gthumb-data - 3.12.2-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gthumb package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.2-1').
